title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The amendment includes changes in the expected family contribution and the grant amount. Additionally, $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for the same academic year. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, with a total appropriation of $4,331,000,000. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for interest on education loans is increased to $3,750 for the taxable year. Additionally, the phaseout limits are raised to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers) and will be adjusted for inflation after 2007. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. Repeal of EGTRRA Sunset: Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS: Increase in allowable contributions to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. Repeal of EGTRRA Sunset for employer-provided educational assistance. SEC. 5. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for employer-provided educational assistance. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 shall not apply to section 411, extending the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance.
